meanings.def: to push a sharp, pointed object, especially a knife, into somebody, killing or injuring them
examples: He was stabbed to death in a racist attack.
She stabbed him in the arm with a screwdriver.
He is accused of repeatedly stabbing a 16-year-old boy.
He was fatally stabbed.
He was found stabbed in his car.
He was stabbed in the chest.
Tina accidentally stabbed herself with her pencil.

meanings.def: to make a short, aggressive or violent movement with a finger or pointed object
examples: stab something (at/into/through something) He stabbed his finger angrily at my chest.
She stabbed her cigarette into the ashtray.
I stabbed at my meat with my fork.
stab somebody/something (with something) She stabbed the air with her fork.
stab at/into/through something (figurative) The pain stabbed at his chest.

meanings.def: to do or say something that harms somebody who trusts you

idioms.def: to do or say something that harms somebody who trusts you

meanings.def: an act of stabbing or trying to stab somebody/something; a wound caused by stabbing
examples: He received several stabs in the chest.
She died of a single stab wound to the heart.
The boy made a stab at the pig.
a stab to the chest

meanings.def: a sudden sharp pain or unpleasant feeling
examples: She felt a sudden stab of pain in the chest.
a stab of guilt/fear/pity/jealousy, etc.
He felt a sharp stab of disappointment.
stab (at something) He found the test difficult but nevertheless made a good stab at it.
stab (at doing something) Countless people have had a stab at solving the riddle.
I’ve always enjoyed acting, but I’d like to have a stab at directing one day.
He took his first stab at directing.
I had a stab at answering the question.
She made a half-hearted stab at medical school, and quickly withdrew.

meanings.def: a guess; something you do without knowing what the result will be
examples: The figure he came up with was really just a shot in the dark.
It was only a stab in the dark, but I hoped I could learn something.

meanings.def: an act that harms somebody, done by a person they thought was a friend
examples: Her refusal to support his campaign was a real stab in the back.

idioms.def: a guess; something you do without knowing what the result will be
examples: The figure he came up with was really just a shot in the dark.
It was only a stab in the dark, but I hoped I could learn something.

idioms.def: an act that harms somebody, done by a person they thought was a friend
examples: Her refusal to support his campaign was a real stab in the back.
